Interval History: Mr. Horn is a 60 y.o. male w/ h/o idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis s/p single right lung transplant in April 2094 whose post-op course has been complicated by CMV viremia, valcyte-induced myelosuppression and severe deconditioning. Mr. Horn was most recently admitted from 12/11/94 through 12/30/94 for complaints of severe fatigue and dyspnea, although without symptoms of infection or acute graft rejection. His main complaint was generalized weakness and fatiguability even w/ very minimal activity. Additionally, he reported a very poor appetite and continued weight loss.
During that admission, he was transfused to a Hct>30 and his PFTs ultimately returned back to baseline. His weakness was felt to be primarily related to his malnutrition as he was documented as having an inadequate caloric intake. Nutrition was consulted, a PEG tube was placed and tube feeds were started to supplement his nutrition. He was discharged without incident on 12/30.
The patient continued w/ Nepro boluses and nocturnal TF at home and demonstrated an 8 lb weight gain in less than 2 months. He was improving until blood work revealed a positive CMV antigenemia (7 cells) on 1/29/95. Transplant ID was consulted and the patient was restarted on Valcyte 450 QOD, and then later bumped up to QD dosing based on ID recommendations. He again experienced myelosuppression and was started on neupogen 300 mcg sc qd on 2/14/95 for a WBC of 0.6. At that time is HCT was 24.8 and PLTs 32K.
A repeat CBC was obtained today and revealed worsening myelosuppression; Hct 21.6/Hgb 6.9, WBC 0.4 and PLTs 15K. Case was discussed with Dr. Valerio and the patient was contacted and instructed to present to the BCC ER for further evaluation and treatment.
Past medical history: 1. Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (pathology consistent with UIP), first diagnosed in 2090. 2. Obstructive sleep apnea. 3. Coronary artery disease. 4. Type 2 diabetes. 5. GERD. 6. UTI (ESBL Klebsiella). 7. C. diff colitis. 8. Spontaneous pneumothoraces. 9. Right peroneal palsy and foot drop. 10. Valcyte-induced myelosuppression
PAST SURGICAL HISTORY: 1. Right VATS and wedge biopsy 2091. 2. Left thoracostomy 2/2094. 3. PTCA, approximately 2085.
